intro: Jatropha loeflingii, commonly known as the Mexican physic nut, is a shrub native to Central America and northern South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain toxic seeds, which are used in traditional medicine. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in disturbed soils. Due to its toxicity, it is important to handle the plant with care.
